BootGrdWrn.label: Enable Boot Guard warning message at build time

PTTWrn.label: Enable Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology warning message at build time

TargetType.label: Target Type
TargetType.help_text: Select target type. This setting is configurable from the toolbar.

IfwiBuildVersion.help_text: 32-bit value to use as the IFWI build version number

VerifySigningKeysAgainstOemKeyManifest.label: Verify manifset signing keys against the OEM Key Manifest.
VerifySigningKeysAgainstOemKeyManifest.help_text: Indicates whether or not FIT should verify that the OEM Key Manifest contains the hash of the public keys used for signing sub-partitions provided by the OEM.

InputFile.label: IUnit Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the IUnit binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PMC Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the PMC binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

UCodePatch1InputFile.label: uCode Patch 1 Input File
UCodePatch1InputFile.help_text: This loads the uCode Patch 1 binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

UCodePatch2InputFile.label: uCode Patch 2 Input File
UCodePatch2InputFile.help_text: This loads the uCode Patch 2 binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: Intel(R) TXE Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Intel (R) TXE binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: IAFW/BIOS Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the IAFW/BIOS binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

EnableSplitObb.label: Enable Split OBB
EnableSplitObb.help_text: OBB's primary location is on BP2, when enabling splitting of the OBB sub-partition, remaining extra OBB portion will be placed in BP1.

BiosDataSize.label: Bios Data Size
BiosDataSize.help_text: Configures the BIOS data size in SPI target configurations.

InputFile.label: PDR Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Platform Data Sub-Partition binary that will be merged into the into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: PDR Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Platform Data Region. This setting is only applicable for SPI images.

NumberOfComponents.label: Number of Flash Components
NumberOfComponents.help_text: Specifies the number of Flash components that will be installed on the target machine if using SPI. For eMMC and UFS, this represents the number of boot partitions and is fixed at 2.

FlashComponent1Size.label: Flash component 1 Size
FlashComponent1Size.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 1st Flash component if using SPI. This represents the size of the first boot partition if using eMMC/UFS.

FlashComponent2Size.label: Flash component 2 Size
FlashComponent2Size.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 2nd Flash component if using SPI. This represents the size of the second boot partition if using eMMC/UFS and will be equal to the first boot partition size.

BiosRegionOverlap.label: Bios Region Overlap
BiosRegionOverlap.help_text: Overlap Bios and ME regions in SPI mode.

SpiBootSourceEnabled.label: SPI Boot Source Enable/Disable
SpiBootSourceEnabled.help_text: Permanent Enable/Disable SPI Boot Device FPF

UfsBootSourceEnabled.label: UFS Boot Source Enable/Disable
UfsBootSourceEnabled.help_text: Permanent Enable/Disable UFS Boot Device FPF

EmmcBootSourceEnabled.label: eMMc Boot Source Enable/Disable
EmmcBootSourceEnabled.help_text: Permanent Enable/Disable eMMc Boot Device FPF

UfsPhyBinary.label: UFS Phy Init Binary
UfsPhyBinary.help_text: UFS PHY Binary sub-partiion. Maximum size is 1 KB

UfsGppLunEnabled.label: UFS GPP LUN Enable
UfsGppLunEnabled.help_text: Set to 'Enabled' to enable UFS GPP LUN Sub-Partition

UfsGppLunId.label: UFS GPP LUN ID
UfsGppLunId.help_text: The UFS GPP LUN ID is a single byte value stored in the UFS GPP LUN Sub-Partition

HostCpuWriteAccess.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access
HostCpuWriteAccess.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

HostCpuWriteAccessCustom.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access Custom
HostCpuWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

HostCpuReadAccess.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access
HostCpuReadAccess.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

HostCpuReadAccessCustom.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access Custom
HostCpuReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

TxeWriteAccess.label: Intel(R) TXE Write Access
TxeWriteAccess.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the TXE. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

TxeWriteAccessCustom.label: Intel(R) TXE Write Access Custom
TxeWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the TXE. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

TxeReadAccess.label: Intel(R) TXE Read Access
TxeReadAccess.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the TXE. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

TxeReadAccessCustom.label: Intel(R) TXE Read Access Custom
TxeReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the TXE. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

BootBlockSize.label: Boot Block Size
BootBlockSize.help_text: This soft strap only applies when booting from SPI. Boot from LPC (FWH) only supports a 64KB boot block size (Invert A16) and this soft strap value is a don't care. Note No bits are inverted if a Reserved encoding is programmed.

SpiDualIoReadEnable.label: Dual I/O Read Enable
SpiDualIoReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Dual I/O Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

DualOutFastReadSupport.label: Dual Output Fast Read Supported
DualOutFastReadSupport.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure if Dual Output Fast Read is supported. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

SpiDualOutReadEnable.label: Dual Output Read Enable
SpiDualOutReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Dual Output Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP. If parameter table is not detected via the SFDP, this bit has no effect and Dual Output Read is controlled via the Flash Descriptor.Component Section.Dual Output Fast Read Support bit.

FastReadClockFreq.label: Fast Read Clock Frequency
FastReadClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Fast Read. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

FastReadSupport.label: Fast Read Supported
FastReadSupport.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Fast Read capabilities for flash components. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details. Note: This setting needs to be enabled when using Dual / Quad enabled components.

InvalidInstruction0.label: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInstruction0.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction1.label: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInstruction1.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction2.label: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInstruction2.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction3.label: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInstruction3.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction4.label: Invalid Instruction 4
InvalidInstruction4.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction5.label: Invalid Instruction 5
InvalidInstruction5.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction6.label: Invalid Instruction 6
InvalidInstruction6.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction7.label: Invalid Instruction 7
InvalidInstruction7.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

PrrTopSwapOverride.label: Protected Range and Top Swap Override
PrrTopSwapOverride.help_text: For more information, see SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

QuadIoReadEnable.label: Quad I/O Read Enable
QuadIoReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Quad I/O Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

QuadOutReadEnable.label: Quad Output Read Enable
QuadOutReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Quad Output Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.label: Read ID and Read Status Clock Frequency
ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Read ID and Read Status. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

SpiStopPrefetchonFlushPending.label: SPI Stop Prefetch on Flush Pending
SpiStopPrefetchonFlushPending.help_text: This soft-strap determines the reset t value of the BIOS Flash Program Register AFC.SPFP bit.

SpiHostSwSequencingEnableDefault.label: SPI Host Software Sequencing Enable Default
SpiHostSwSequencingEnableDefault.help_text: This strap sets the default value of the CSME ICE.HSSEN register.

SpiDelayBeforeRPMCBusyPollEnable.label: SPI Enable Delay before RPMC busy poll

SpiDelayBeforeEraseBusyPollEnable.label: SPI Enable Delay before erase busy poll

SpiDelayBeforeWriteBusyPollEnable.label: SPI Enable Delay before write busy poll

SpiIdletoDeepPowerDownTimeoutDefault.label: SPI Idle to Deep Power Down Timeout Default
SpiIdletoDeepPowerDownTimeoutDefault.help_text: Specifies the time in microseconds that the Flash Controller waits after all activity is idle before commanding the flash devices to Deep Powerdown. Max is 2^15 = 32768.

WriteEraseClockFreq.label: Write and Erase Clock Frequency
WriteEraseClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Write and Erase. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details.

ProtectedRangeLimit.label: Protected Range Limit
ProtectedRangeLimit.help_text: This field corresponds to FLA (Flash Linear Address) address bits 26:12 and specifies the upper limit of the protected range. Address bits 11:0 are assumed to be FFFh for the limit comparison. Any address greater than the value programmed in this field is unaffected by this protected range. Note: If either Write or Read protection is enabled, then Limit must be configured greater than or equal to Base. See SPI and SMIP Programming Guide for more information.

ProtectedRangeBase.label: Protected Range Base
ProtectedRangeBase.help_text: This field corresponds to FLA (Flash Linear Address) address bits 26:12 and specifies the lower base of the protected range. Address bits 11:0 are assumed to be 000h for the base comparison. Any address less than the value programmed in this field is unaffected by this protected range. Note: Note: If either Write or Read protection is enabled, then Limit must be configured greater than or equal to Base. See SPI and SMIP Programming Guide for more details.

ThermalThrottleUnlock.label: Thermal Throttle Unlock
ThermalThrottleUnlock.help_text: See SPI and SMIP Programming Guide for more information

ExtendedReliabilityEnable.label: Extended Reliability Enable
ExtendedReliabilityEnable.help_text: See SPI and SMIP Programming Guide for more information

SoftSvidEnable.label: Soft SVID Enable
SoftSvidEnable.help_text: See SPI and SMIP Programming Guide for more information

Rail0AlertPollEnable.label: Rail 0 Alert Polling Enable
Rail0AlertPollEnable.help_text: This bit defines whether the STATUS1 register for Rail 0 must be polled on Alert# assertions or not.

Rail0SvidId.label: Rail 0 SVID ID
Rail0SvidId.help_text: This contains the PMIC Rail ID for SVID Rail 0, i.e. Vccgi. PCODE uses this to program the SVID_RAIL0_CONFIG_AND_STATUS register during reset.

Rail1AlertPollEnable.label: Rail 1 Alert Polling Enable
Rail1AlertPollEnable.help_text: This bit defines whether the STATUS1 register for Rail 1 must be polled on Alert# assertions or not.

Rail1SvidId.label: Rail 1 SVID ID
Rail1SvidId.help_text: This contains the PMIC Rail ID for SVID Rail 1, aka Vnn. PCODE uses this to program the SVID_RAIL1_CONFIG_AND_STATUS register during reset.

Rail2AlertPollEnable.label: Rail 2 Alert Polling Enable
Rail2AlertPollEnable.help_text: This bit defines whether the STATUS1 register for Rail 2 must be polled on Alert# assertions or not.

Rail2SvidId.label: Rail 2 SVID ID
Rail2SvidId.help_text: This contains the PMIC Rail ID for SVID Rail 2. PCODE uses this to program the SVID_RAIL2_CONFIG_AND_STATUS register during reset.

Rail3AlertPollEnable.label: Rail 3 Alert Polling Enable
Rail3AlertPollEnable.help_text: This bit defines whether the STATUS1 register for Rail 3 must be polled on Alert# assertions or not

Rail3SvidId.label: Rail 3 SVID ID
Rail3SvidId.help_text: This contains the PMIC Rail ID for SVID Rail 3. PCODE uses this to program the SVID_RAIL3_CONFIG_AND_STATUS register during reset

PmicVrConfig.label: PMIC/VR Configuration
PmicVrConfig.help_text: These are the supported VR types for BXT-P SOC. Intel FW only supports this BOM list.

PrtcBackupPower.label: Persistent PRTC Backup Power
PrtcBackupPower.help_text: FPF that indicates if the device is designed such that it may lose PRTC power more than 10 times throughout the normal lifecycle of the product and hence has no persistent time or AR protection. At EOM, this value is burned to an FPF, and can never be changed

PMC_OEM_SMIP_VERSION.MAJOR_VERSION.help_text: Version information for the PMC OEM SMIP. Used internally by PMC FW team to communicate which SMIP version is in use. OEMs and other users of the SMIP can use this field to identify a version.

PMC_OEM_SMIP_VERSION.CONFIG_VERSION.help_text: Version information for the PMC OEM SMIP. Used internally by PMC FW team to communicate which SMIP version is in use. OEMs and other users of the SMIP can use this field to identify a version.

PMC_OEM_SMIP_VERSION.MINOR_VERSION.help_text: Version information for the PMC OEM SMIP. Used internally by PMC FW team to communicate which SMIP version is in use. OEMs and other users of the SMIP can use this field to identify a version.

PMC_OEM_SMIP_VERSION.ENGR_VERSION.help_text: Version information for the PMC OEM SMIP. Used internally by PMC FW team to communicate which SMIP version is in use. OEMs and other users of the SMIP can use this field to identify a version.

IAI2CVRRdWrInValidAddrRange_0.IAI2CVRRdW.help_text: This field only applicable and programmable if there is an I2C VR attached on the platform. Note that there are 32 of these such registers, IAI2CVRRdWrInValidAddrRange[32:0]. List of register ranges in I2C voltage regulator which are subject to write access control. I2CVR addressing utilizes 2 bytes: MSB (byte 1) is base address; LSB (byte 0) is the offset. The range is from bits[15:0] to bits [31:16]. For example, value 0x56781234 would indicate I2CVR base address 0x12, offset 0x34 to I2CVR base address 0x56, offset 0x78 are inaccessible..

IAI2CVRRdWrInValidAddrRange_1.IAI2CVRRdW.help_text: List of register ranges in I2C voltage regulator which are subject to write access control. I2CVR addressing utilizes 2 bytes: MSB (byte 1) is base address; LSB (byte 0) is the offset. The range is from bits[15:0] to bits [31:16]. For example, value 0x56781234 would indicate I2CVR base address 0x12, offset 0x34 to I2CVR base address 0x56, offset 0x78 are inaccessible..

LJ1PLL_SETTINGS_FORCE_COLD_RESET.LJ1PLL_.help_text: LJ1PLL settings will force a cold reset when this is non-zero. Normal usage is to force a cold reset (assert this bit) if changes to LJ1PLL are desired, otherwise BIOS is expected to cause a cold reset for LJ1PLL changes to take effect.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_1_DEFAULT.SSC_EN.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_1 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_1_DEFAULT.SSC_EN_OVR.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_1 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_2_DEFAULT.SSC_FRAC_STE.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_2 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_2_DEFAULT.SSC_MODE.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_2 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_2_DEFAULT.SSC_CYC_TO_P.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_2 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_5_DEFAULT.PLL_RATIO_IN.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_5 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_5_DEFAULT.PLL_RATIO_FR.help_text: LJ1PLL_RW_CONTROL_5 register default value to be programmed during boot.

LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_1_DEFAULT.SSC_EN.help_text: LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_1 register default value to be programmed during boot - highly recommended not to change these fields as they are related to high-speed IOs.

LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_1_DEFAULT.SSC_EN_OVR.help_text: LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_1 register default value to be programmed during boot - highly recommended not to change these fields as they are related to high-speed IOs.

LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_2_DEFAULT.SSC_FRAC_STEP.help_text: LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_2 register default value to be programmed during boot - highly recommended not to change these fields as they are related to high-speed IOs.

LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_2_DEFAULT.SSC_MODE.help_text: LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_2 register default value to be programmed during boot - highly recommended not to change these fields as they are related to high-speed IOs.

LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_2_DEFAULT.SSC_CYC_TO_PE.help_text: LCPLL_RW_CONTROL_2 register default value to be programmed during boot - highly recommended not to change these fields as they are related to high-speed IOs.

TCO_NO_REBOOT.TCO_NO_REBOOT.help_text: GCR.PMC_CFG.NO_REBOOT configuration. 1'b0 = reboot, 1'b1 = no_reboot. Disabling of TCO_NO_REBOOT is required for resetbreak to occur when handling reset from TCO source.. TCO is a software-controlled platform-level watchdog timer

RESETBUTTON_DEBOUNCE_DIS.RESETBUTTON_DEB.help_text: Value to be programmed for the HW bit to disable the reset button debounce circuit. Debounce the circuit may be required depending on reset button hardware

S0IX_VR_RAMP_TIMER.S0IX_VR_RAMP_TIMER.help_text: Default value to write to VNNAON_LDO_CTL.S0IX_VR_RAMP_TIMER PMU register field. RTC clock timer value for Vnn/Vccram rail ramp during S0ix exit. The default value of 0hA0 corresponds to 5.12 ms. A value of 0x01 would correspond to 32 us. 0x01: 32 us, 0x02: 64 us, 0xA0: 5.12 ms. Precision is 32e-6..

USB_AUXCLK_GATING_S0IX_OVRD.USB_AUXCLK_G.help_text: Enable USB aux clk gating during Sx/S0ix entry by setting the override to 1, disabled by default. An OEM would use these bit to declare that all USB2 ports are disconnected, or unpowered in SX or S0ix, or both in their closed/controlled system. If an OEM is sure that the USB bus implementation (devices and hubs) on their platforms can tolerate a resume rebroadcast/reflection from the host(SoC) that is longer than the spec requirement of 1ms (up to ~1.5ms) then they can set the overrides so that USB aux clk gating is always enabled on entry to Sx/S0ix. The spec timing that is POTENTIALLY being violated here is: TURSM (Time from detecting downstream resume to rebroadcast): 1.0 ms max (no min specified) USB2.0 spec, Section 7.1.7.7 . Override for always enabling USB AUX Clock Gating during S0ix

USB_AUXCLK_GATING_SX_OVRD.USB_AUXCLK_GAT.help_text: Enable USB aux clk gating during Sx/S0ix entry by setting the override to 1, disabled by default. An OEM would use these bit to declare that all USB2 ports are disconnected, or unpowered in SX or S0ix, or both in their closed/controlled system. If an OEM is sure that the USB bus implementation (devices and hubs) on their platforms can tolerate a resume rebroadcast/reflection from the host(SoC) that is longer than the spec requirement of 1ms (up to ~1.5ms) then they can set the overrides so that USB aux clk gating is always enabled on entry to Sx/S0ix. The spec timing that is POTENTIALLY being violated here is: TURSM (Time from detecting downstream resume to rebroadcast): 1.0 ms max (no min specified) USB2.0 spec, Section 7.1.7.7 . Override for always enabling USB AUX Clock Gating during Sx

SUS_STAT_DEASSERT_TIME.SUS_STAT_DEASSERT.help_text: Minimum time guaranteed to be elapsed before SUS_STAT deassertion. Note this feature not available in BXTp-A0; available BXTp-B0 and beyond.. Note this feature not available in BXTp-A0; available BXTp-B0 and beyond.

IASecureRdWrInValidAddrRange_0.IASecureR.help_text: Note that there are 32 of these such registers, IASecureRdWrInvalidAddrRange[32:0]. Secure PMIC Black list Registers for HOST. List of register ranges in PMIC which are subject to write access control. Host does NOT have access to these registers when Secure. PMIC addressing utilizes 2 bytes: MSB (byte 1) is base address; LSB (byte 0) is the offset. The range is from bits[15:0] to bits [31:16]. For example, value 0x56781234 would indicate PMIC base address 0x12, offset 0x34 to PMIC base address 0x56, offset 0x78 are inaccessible for a secure HOST..

InsecureWrRegBitMskAddr_0.InsecureWrRegB.help_text: Note that there are 16 of these such registers, InsecureWrRegBitMskAddr[15:0]. Information for bitwise set or clear permissions for the insecure blacklist registers. The data contains the register address (bits[15:8],[7:0] are the device and offset), mask of bits which cannot be SET on a write (bits[23:16]) and mask of bits which cannot be CLEARED on a write (bits[31:24)..

ProcEmulation.label: Processor Emulation

OdmIDIntelServices.label: ODM ID used by Intel(R) Services
OdmIDIntelServices.help_text: This setting is for entering the ODM ID for Intel(R) Services to identify the ODM Board builder. Note: This ID is either generated by or registered with Intel(R ) Services Web servers.

SysIntIdIntelServices.label: System Integrator ID used by Intel(R) Services
SysIntIdIntelServices.help_text: This setting is for entering the System Integrator ID for Intel(R) Services to identify the System Integrator. Note: This ID is either generated by or registered with Intel(R ) Services Web servers.

ReservedIdIntelServices.label: Reserved ID used by Intel(R) Services
ReservedIdIntelServices.help_text: This setting is for entering the Reserved ID for Intel(R) Services currently not used.

FwAutoBist.label: Automatic Built in Self Test
FwAutoBist.help_text: This setting enables the firmware Automatic Built in Self Test which is executed during first platform boot after initial image flashing.

DataClearSecurityPolicy.label: Data Clear Security Policy
DataClearSecurityPolicy.help_text: See SPI/SMIP Programming guide for details.

DisableDataClear.label: Disable Data Clear
DisableDataClear.help_text: This setting will disable the 'DATA CLEAR' TXEI command after EOM

EndOfManufacturing.label: End of Manufacturing Enable
EndOfManufacturing.help_text: EOM should be set when the image is built in production mode. This will trigger close manuf flows in FW. This setting is not configurable in SPI mode.

PostManufLockEnable.label: Post Manufacturing NVAR Configuration Enabled
PostManufLockEnable.help_text: This setting determines if modifications to Customer configuable NVARs is to be allowed after close of manufacturing.

Imr00.help_text: Override IMR size setting. Set to 0 to use default configuration value.

Imr01.help_text: Override IMR size setting. Set to 0 to use default configuration value.

PavpSupported.label: PAVP Supported
PavpSupported.help_text: This setting determines if the Protected Audio Video Path (PAVP) feature will be permanently disabled in the FW image.

CEKBinary.label: Content Encryption Key
CEKBinary.help_text: This option is for entering the raw hash 256 bit string or certificate file for the Content Encryption

Lspcon4kdisp.label: LSPCON Internal Display Port 1 - LSPCON / 4K
Lspcon4kdisp.help_text: This setting determines which port for LSPCON will be connected to the HDCP 2.2 bridge adapter Display 1.

Hdcp5kedisp1.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 1 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp1.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 1. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

Hdcp5kedisp2.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 2 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp2.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 2. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

VgaPort.label: VGA Display Port
VgaPort.help_text: This setting determines if VGA adaptor is configured for port A.

SmipSigningKey.label: SMIP Signing Key
SmipSigningKey.help_text: This is the path to the private key used to sign the SMIP, while public key hash of it is included in the OEM hash manifest. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

OemPublicKeyHash.label: OEM Public Key Hash
OemPublicKeyHash.help_text: Raw hash string for the SHA-256 hash of the OEM public key corresponding to the private key used to sign the OEM Key hash manifest. When manufacture is completed, this hash value is burned into an FPF, and is permament. This value is used to verify the OEM Key hash, and also DnX images. OEM signing is disabled when this hash is set to all 0s.

OemExtInputFile.label: OEM Key Manifest Binary
OemExtInputFile.help_text: Signed manifest file containing hashes of keys used for signing components of image. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardKeyManifestId.label: Key Manifest ID
BtGuardKeyManifestId.help_text: ODM identifier used during the Key manifest authentication process. This setting is only configurable, and must be non-0, when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardProfileConfig.value_list: Boot Guard Profile 0 - Legacy,,Boot Guard Profile 1 - V,,Boot Guard Profile 2 - VM
BtGuardProfileConfig.label: Boot Profile
BtGuardProfileConfig.help_text: Boot Guard Profile 0 - Legacy is for platforms that do not wish to enable Boot Guard boot block verification or measurement protection. Boot Guard Profile 1 - V is Strict Verification Enforcement. Prevents unverified bios components from running. Boot Guard Profile 2 - VM is Strict Verification and Measurement enforcement. Prevents unverified Bios components from running. When manufacture is completed, this value is burned into an FPF, and is permament. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardArbOemKeyManifest.label: OEM Key Manifest Anti Rollback Enable

SpiOverTpmClkFreq.label: TPM Clock Frequency
SpiOverTpmClkFreq.help_text: This field identifies the serial clock frequency for TPM on SPI. This field is undefined if the TPM on SPI is disabled either by softstrap or fuse. This field is defined with a broad range to support SOC implementations. The listed frequencies are approximate.

OemSigningDalApplet.label: Allow OEM Signing of DAL Applets
OemSigningDalApplet.help_text: FPF that enables OEM signing of DAL applets.

ActiveProfile.label: Active Profile
ActiveProfile.help_text: The name of the profile to be used in the output image. Additionally, all profiles will be saved as extra binaries.

IshSupported.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Supported
IshSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to permanently disable ISH FPF on the platform.

IshPowerUpState.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Initial Power State
IshPowerUpState.help_text: This setting allows customers to determine the power up state for ISH.

Length.help_text: Total size (in bytes) of the ISH code partition including reserved space. It is recommended to be at least 256kb.

InputFile.label: Input File
InputFile.help_text: Path to your ISH firmware binary file.

PdtBinary.label: PDT Binary File
PdtBinary.help_text: Path to your PDT binary file.

IUnitSecureTouch.label: Secure Touch
IUnitSecureTouch.help_text: If enabled, the CSI streams identified by the CAMERA_MASK register have all pixels replaced by a fixed value (i.e. disable camera)

IUnitFWSecureMode.label: Firmware Secure Mode
IUnitFWSecureMode.help_text: If enabled, access blockers in IS and PS are enabled, so as to authenticate camera firmware. Must be enabled for FW authentication flow and execution of authenticated FW.

IUnitDfxSecFeatEnOvrd.label: Dfx Secure Feature En Override
IUnitDfxSecFeatEnOvrd.help_text: If enabled, NPK is enabled, else dfxsecure_feature_en signal is checked to see if the NPK feature should be enabled or not.

IUnitCameraMask1.label: Camera Mask 1
IUnitCameraMask1.help_text: Bit mask that identifies cameras that are subject to secure touch, in CSI port A. 1 indicates camera is subject to secure touch, 0 means it is not.

IUnitCameraMask2.label: Camera Mask 2
IUnitCameraMask2.help_text: Bit mask that identifies cameras that are subject to secure touch, in CSI port B. 1 indicates camera is subject to secure touch, 0 means it is not.

IUnitPortIdA.label: PORT_ID_A
IUnitPortIdA.help_text: Specifies configuration of cameras and data lanes allocated to each camera port, for CSI port A. (MSB not used). The 20-pins of set A can be configured and connected to up to four cameras in the platform using MIPI DPHY protocol. The field PORT_ID_A is used to select the number of cameras (also called ports) and the number of data lanes allocated to each camera port. See IUNIT AE for more information on how to configure this field.

IUnitPortIdB.label: PORT_ID_B
IUnitPortIdB.help_text: Specifies configuration of cameras and data lanes allocated to each camera port, for CSI port B. (MSB not used). The 12-pins of set B can be configured and connected to either four cameras in the platform using MIPI CPHY protocol OR up to two cameras in the platform using the MIPI DPHY protocol. See IUNIT AE for more information on how to configure this field.

IdlmBinary.label: IDLM Binary
IdlmBinary.help_text: This allows an IDLM binary to be merged into output image built by Intel (R) FIT

IntelTrcHubBinary.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Binary
IntelTrcHubBinary.help_text: This loads the Intel (R) Trace Hub binary that will be merged into the into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

UnlockToken.label: Unlock Token
UnlockToken.help_text: This allows the OEM to input an Unlock Token binary file for closed chassis debug.

NpkPtiDis.label: Early boot NPK
NpkPtiDis.help_text: This configuration allows enabling/disabling NorthPeak logging capability for early boot. By enabling this feature, TXE engine will control GPIO_0 to GPIO_4 pins for PTI. Disable it if you do not wish for TXE to control these GPIOs

DbgOverridePreProdSi.label: Debug Override Pre-Production Silicon
DbgOverridePreProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with pre-production platform debugging. This control has no effect if used on production silicon. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details).

DbgOverrideProdSi.label: Debug Override Production Silicon
DbgOverrideProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with production platform debugging. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details).

EmulateOverrideSocDevReuseDisabled.label: Override SoC Device Reuse HVM fuse value Emulation
EmulateOverrideSocDevReuseDisabled.help_text: See SPI and SMIP Programming Guide for more information

DnxPlatformId.label: Platform ID
DnxPlatformId.help_text: Platform ID that DnX uses to verify the image is suitable for the platform. Before FPFs lock, this field is ignored and DnX will accept any image. After FPS lock, only images with this Platform ID will be accepted by DnX.

DnxOemId.label: OEM ID
DnxOemId.help_text: OEM ID that DnX uses to verify the image is suitable for the platform. Before FPFs lock, this field is ignored and DnX will accept any image. After FPF lock, only images with this OEM ID will be accepted by DnX.

BuildEnabled.help_text: Should Intel FIT build a DnX image

SigningKey.help_text: The path to the private key to use to sign the DnX image. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

DnxUsbStringDescriptor1.label: USB String Descriptor 1
DnxUsbStringDescriptor1.help_text: Used by ROM to communicate manufacturer string (32 characters) to recovery host. If this descriptor is not defined by OEM, identified by all 0s, ROM will use default descriptors

DnxUsbStringDescriptor2.label: USB String Descriptor 2
DnxUsbStringDescriptor2.help_text: Used by ROM to communicate manufacturer string (32 characters) to recovery host. If this descriptor is not defined by OEM, identified by all 0s, ROM will use default descriptors

DnxSpiIfwiRegion.label: Enable DnX SPI Region IFWI
DnxSpiIfwiRegion.help_text: Enable DnX SPI flash update of IFWI region.

DnxSpiPdrRegion.label: Enable DnX SPI Region PDR
DnxSpiPdrRegion.help_text: Enable DnX SPI flash update of PDR region.
